Introduction.Name: Ogre Kingdoms

Dispell.Name: Spells of the Da Big Waaagh!

Introduction.Annotation: The Ogre Kingdoms are the rightful and sovereign domain of the large and brutish Ogre race. Wandering tribes of Ogres can be found wrecking their way across the globe, erecting many strongholds and plundering far off and exotic lands the likes of which no man will ever see in their lifetime. Yet no matter how far away they may be, all Ogres refer to the scattered tribal kingdoms that dominate the slopes and river valleys of the Mountains of Mourn their rightful, hard-earned homeland. It is here, amongst the frozen peaks and blistering blizzards that mighty Tyrants rule over their own brutal kingdoms, warring amongst each other, looting, extorting and ransacking all before them as a tribute to their own gluttonous appetite and their ever-hungry God, the Great Maw.

Artefact.Name: Mawseeker
Artefact.Description: A Tyrant with the Mawseeker name has +1 Toughness on his profile. He also suffers from the Stupidity special rule.

Artefact.Name: Wallcrusher
Artefact.Description: Wallcrushers do one additional Impact Hit on a successful Ogre Charge. In addition, Wallcrushers ignore all the effects of obstacles when attacking units that are defending them -he is likely to barge through or smash it down on top of the foe. This does not benefit a unit he joins.

Artefact.Name: Kineater
Artefact.Rule: Any friendly unit within 6" may re-roll failed Panic tests
Artefact.Description: Any friendly unit within 6" of a Kineater may re-roll failed Panic tests.

Artefact.Name: Mountaineater
Artefact.Rule: Never be wounded on a score better than a 3+
Hits that cause automatic Wounds are unaffected
Artefact.Description: A Mountaineater will never be wounded on a score better than a 3+. For instance, if the Mountaineater was hit by a cannonball (normally wounding him on the roll of a 2+) the cannonball would only wound him on a 3+ . Hits that cause automatic Wounds are unaffected.

Artefact.Name: Giantbreaker
Artefact.Rule: May never refuse challenges, and neither he nor a unit he is with may choose to flee as a charge reaction
Artefact.Description: A character with the Giantbreaker name has +1 Strength on his profile. He may never refuse challenges, and neither he nor a unit he is with may choose to flee as a charge reaction.

Artefact.Name: Deathcheater
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, nominate one model in base contact that has hit the Deathcheater but not yet rolled To Wound: that model must re-roll all successful To Wound rolls this phase
Artefact.Description: Once per game, nominate one model in base contact that has hit the Deathcheater but not yet rolled To Wound. That model must re-roll all successful To Wound rolls this phase. This includes all rolls To Wound made by the model's mount, chariot or other extra attacks.

Artefact.Name: Longstrider
Artefact.Description: A character with the Longstrider big name has + 1 Movement on his profile.

Artefact.Name: Beastkiller
Artefact.Rule: Any attacks against a Large Target gains +1 on his rolls To Wound
Artefact.Description: When making attacks against a Large Target (either close combat or shooting), the Beastkiller gains +1 on his rolls To Wound — the Hunter knows just where to strike his prey for maximum effect. If the character is using a magic weapon, then he does not get this bonus.

Artefact.Name: Brawlerguts
Artefact.Rule: Re-roll failed To Wound rolls from Impact Hits
Artefact.Description: Brawlerguts (but not their mounts) re-roll failed To Wound rolls from their Impact Hits.

Artefact.Name: Thundermace
Artefact.Rule: Thundercrush Attack
Artefact.Description: Always Strikes Last. Requires Two Hands. In close combat, the wielder of the Siegebreaker has +2 Strength. Roll To Hit against the enemy's Initiative instead of his Weapon Skill, and no Parry saves are allowed — it is impossible to deflect a blow from the weapon. In addition, when assaulting models in a building, the wielder can make a 'Siegebreaker Attack' instead of attacking normally in the Close Combat phase (though he may still Stomp). A Siegebreaker Attack inflicts D6 hits with a Strength equal to the height of the building in inches, up to a maximum Strength of 10 (so, for example, models in a building that is 6 inches high would suffer D6 Strength 6 hits). Measure from the base of the building to its highest point.

Artefact.Name: Siegebreaker
Artefact.Rule: Siegebreaker Attack
Artefact.Description: Always Strikes Last. Requires Two Hands. In close combat, the wielder of the Siegebreaker has +2 Strength. Roll To Hit against the enemy's Initiative instead of his Weapon Skill, and no Parry saves are allowed — it is impossible to deflect a blow from the weapon. In addition, when assaulting models in a building, the wielder can make a 'Siegebreaker Attack' instead of attacking normally in the Close Combat phase (though he may still Stomp). A Siegebreaker Attack inflicts D6 hits with a Strength equal to the height of the building in inches, up to a maximum Strength of 10 (so, for example, models in a building that is 6 inches high would suffer D6 Strength 6 hits). Measure from the base of the building to its highest point.

Artefact.Name: Gnoblar Thiefstone
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (2)
Roll on the table when the model is deployed to see if the Thiefstone has helped them to 'find' any useful items
Artefact.Description:
A Gnoblar Thiefstone grants the bearer Magic Resistance (2). In addition, roll on the following table when the model is deployed to see if the Thiefstone has helped them to 'find' any useful items. Note that this may result in the bearer of the Thiefstone having two Magic Talismans (the Thiefstone and the item from the table). In addition, if the item that has been 'found' is being used by another character (friend or foe), then the other character loses the item — it's been stolen!

D6 Item
1 Nothing
2 Luckstone
3 Talisman of Protection
4 The Other Trickster's Shard
5 The Ruby Ring of Ruin
6 Talisman of Preservation

Artefact.Name: Greedy Fist
Artefact.Description: The wearer has 4-1 Strength and a 6+ ward save. If a Magic Weapon inflicts a Wound that is saved by this ward save, its magical properties are consumed by the Greedy Fist; it is treated as a normal, non-magical weapon of the same type for the remainder of the game. If no type is listed, it is treated as a hand weapon. In addition, an enemy Wizard loses a Wizard level and a randomly selected spell each time they are hit by an Ogre wearing the Greedy Fist.

Artefact.Name: Gut Maw
Artefact.Rule: Recovers one lost Wound (up to his starting number) for each unsaved Wound he causes in a challenge
Artefact.Description: Heavy Armour. An Ogre wearing the Gut Maw has the Terror special rule. In addition, he recovers one lost Wound (up to his starting number) for each unsaved Wound he causes in a challenge.

Artefact.Name: Grut's Sickle
Artefact.Rule: At the start of the Ogre Magic phase, can inflict a single Wound on any unit he has joined: then he adds +2 to all casting rolls he makes during that Magic phase
Artefact.Description: At the start of the Ogre Magic phase, the bearer of Grut's Sickle can inflict a single Wound on any unit he has joined. If he does so, then he adds +2 to all casting rolls he makes during that Magic phase. A Wound inflicted by Grut's Sickle is distributed as a shooting attack, and may not be saved in any way. Roll 2D6 at the end of each Magic phase where Grut's Sickle is used; on a roll of 3 or more nothing happens, but on a roll of double-1 the unit turns upon and slays the wielder of Grut's Sickle, and he is removed as a casualty with no saves of any kind allowed.

Artefact.Name: Hellheart
Artefact.Rule: All enemy Wizards within D6 x 5" of the bearer must roll on the Miscast table, add an extra dispel dice to the Ogre's dispel pool for each enemy Wizard that was forced to roll on the Miscast table, one use only
Artefact.Description: One Use Only. The Hellheart can be used at the start of one of the opposing side's Magic phases, immediately after rolling for the Winds of Magic. All enemy Wizards within D6 x 5" of the bearer must roll on the Miscast table. Special rules or magic items that affect a normal miscast roll can be used against miscasts caused by the Hellheart. After resolving all the miscasts, add an extra dispel dice to the Ogre's dispel pool for each enemy Wizard that was forced to roll on the Miscast table.

Artefact.Name: Rock Eye
Artefact.Rule: At the beginning of each Ogre turn, pick one unit in the line of sight: the opposing player must announce the presence of any hidden models and say what magic items are carried by the unit or any characters that have joined it
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of each Ogre turn, pick one unit in the line of sight of the bearer of the Rock Eye. The opposing player must announce the presence of any hidden models (Fanatics, Assassins and the like) within that unit, and say what magic items are carried by the unit or any characters that have joined it. He need not say who carries them, however.

Artefact.Name: Rune Maw
Artefact.Rule: When any spell targeting a unit is successfully cast, roll a D6: on 2+ the caster must choose a new target for the spell, if no other target is available, then the spell is wasted
Artefact.Description: When any spell targeting a unit with the Rune Maw is successfully cast, roll a D6. On a roll of 2+, the caster must choose a new target for the spell. If no other target is available (because no other target is in range or all eligible units have already been targeted, for example), then the spell is wasted but still counts as having been cast. Spells that do not specifically target the unit are not affected by the Rune Maw.

Artefact.Name: Dragonhide Banner
Artefact.Rule: The bearer of the banner can use Strength 3 Breath Weapon: a unit hit by the icy blast has the Always Strikes Last special rule until the end of its next turn
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Dragonhide Banner can re-roll all To Hit, To Wound and saving throw rolls of 1 on the turn they make a successful charge. In addition, the bearer of the banner can use it to unleash an icy blast. This is a Strength 3 Breath Weapon. A unit hit by the icy blast has the Always Strikes Last special rule until the end of its next turn.

Artefact.Name: Helm of Discord
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. In addition, at the start of each Close Combat phase, choose an enemy character in base contact with the bearer or his unit. That character must immediately take a Leadership test. If the test is failed, the character succumbs to the helm's sibilant whispers of malice and jealousy. In this Close Combat phase, the victim cannot make attacks and is hit automatically.

Artefact.Name: Glittering Scales
Artefact.Description: Light armour. Enemies suffer a -1 to hit penalty when attempting to strike the wearer in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Shield of Ptolos
Artefact.Rule: 1+ armour save against shooting attacks
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer has a 1+ armour save against shooting attacks.

Artefact.Name: Spellshield
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (1)
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer gains Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Gambler's Armour
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. The Gambler's Armour grants the wearer a 6+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Dragonhelm
Artefact.Rule: 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. The wearer has a 2+ ward save against flaming attacks.

Artefact.Name: Enchanted Shield
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer counts his armour save as being two points higher than normal, rather than the usual one point that a shield would normally grant.

Artefact.Name: Charmed Shield
Artefact.Rule: First hit suffered is discounted on a roll of 2+
Artefact.Description: Shield. One use only. The first hit suffered by the bearer of the Charmed Shield is discounted on a roll of 2+.

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Preservation
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Preservation grants the bearer a 4+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Obsidian Lodestone
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (3)
Artefact.Description: The Obsidian Lodestone grants Magic Resistance (3).

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Endurance
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Endurance grants the bearer a 5+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Dawnstone
Artefact.Description: The bearer re-rolls failed armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Opal Amulet
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Opal Amulet bestows a 4+ Ward save against the first wound suffered by the bearer, after which its power fades and it cannot be used again during the game.

Artefact.Name: Obsidian Trinket
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (1)
Artefact.Description: The Obsidian Trinket grants Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Protection grants the bearer a 6+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Seed of Rebirth
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Seed of Rebirth has the Regeneration (6+) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Dragonbane Gem
Artefact.Rule: 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Dragonbane Gem has a 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks.

Artefact.Name: Pidgeon Plucker Pendant
Artefact.Rule: 5+ Ward save against wounds caused in close combat by models that have the Fly special rule
Artefact.Description: This item grants the bearer a 5+ Ward save against wounds caused in close combat by models that have the Fly special rule.

Artefact.Name: Luckstone
Artefact.Rule: May re-roll single failed armour save
Artefact.Description: The Luckstone allows the bearer to re-roll single failed armour save.

Artefact.Name: Rampager's Standard
Artefact.Rule: May re-roll charge distance dice
Artefact.Description: A unit with this magic standard can re-roll its charge distance dice.

Artefact.Name: Wailing Banner
Artefact.Description: A unit with this banner causes Terror in its enemies.

Artefact.Name: Ranger's Standard
Artefact.Rule: Strider
Artefact.Description: A unit with the Ranger's Standard has the Strider special rule.

Artefact.Name: Razor Standard
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Razor Standard have the Armour Piercing special rule.

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: A unit with this banner adds +1 to combat resolution.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Swiftness
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Banner of Swiftness have +1 to their Movement characteristic.

Artefact.Name: Lichebone Pennant
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (1)
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Lichebone Pennant have Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Standard of Discipline
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Standard of Discipline have +1 Leadership, but cannot use the General's Inspiring Presence special rule.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Eternal Flame
Artefact.Rule: Flaming Attacks
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Banner of Eternal Flame have Flaming Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Gleaming Pennant
Artefact.Rule: Сan re-roll first failed Leadership test
Artefact.Description: One use only. A unit with the Gleaming Pennant can re-roll its first failed Leadership test.

Artefact.Name: Scarecrow Banner
Artefact.Rule: Сauses Fear in models with the Fly special rule
Artefact.Description: A unit with the Scarecrow Banner causes Fear in models with the Fly special rule.

Artefact.Name: Book of Ashur
Artefact.Rule: +1 bonus on attempts to cast and dispel
Artefact.Description: The bearer receives a +1 bonus on attempts to cast and dispel.

Artefact.Name: Feedback Scroll
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, roll a dice for every dice used to cast the spell, the casting Wizard takes a wound for every result of 5+ rolled, with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Feedback Scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but, after the spell has been resolved, roll a dice for every dice used to cast the spell. The casting Wizard takes a wound for every result of 5+ rolled, with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Scroll of Leeching
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, add a number of dispel dice to your pool equal to the number of dice used to cast the spell
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Scroll of Leeching can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but, after the spell has been resolved, the bearer of the scroll adds a number of dispel dice to his pool equal to the number of dice used to cast the spell (remember that your dispel pool cannot exceed 12 dice).

Artefact.Name: Sivejir's Hex Scroll
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, the enemy wizard must roll equal to or under his wizard level on a D6, if he fails he becomes a small, slimy toad
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Hex Scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but a portion of the spell's energy is transformed and redirected at the caster. The enemy wizard can resist the spell's effects by rolling equal to or under his wizard level on a D6. If he fails, an amphibian transformation takes hold and he becomes a small, slimy toad! Whilst transformed, the wizard cannot channel or cast spells, all of his magic items and mundane equipment (armour, weapons, etc.) temporarily stop working and all of his characteristics are reduced to 1 (except for his wounds, which are unaffected). His controlling player can roll a D6 at the start of each of his subsequent magic phases; the spell dissipates on a roll of 4+ and the wizard returns to his normal form (but still attempts to eat flies for several days afterward).

Artefact.Name: Power Scroll
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, during one casting attempt any roll of a double will cause Irresistible Force (and a Miscast)
Artefact.Description: One use only. A Power Scroll can be used when the Wizard makes a casting attempt. During that casting attempt, any roll of a double will cause irresistible force (and a miscast).

Artefact.Name: Wand of Jet
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, can increase one of his casting results by an additional +D6, after other casting dice have been rolled
Artefact.Description: One use only. The bearer can increase one of his casting results by an additional +D6, after other casting dice have been rolled. This extra power dice can contribute to casting a spell with Irresistible Force (and a Miscast).

Artefact.Name: Forbidden Rod
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, adds +D6 dice in the power pool and inflicts D3 wounds
Artefact.Description: One use only. The forbidden rod adds +D6 dice in the power pool at the start of the caster's own magic phase, but also inflicts D3 wounds on the bearer (with no armour saves allowed).

Artefact.Name: Trickster's Shard
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, declare you are using Shard at the start of one of your magic phases, for the duration of the phase, when one of spells is dispelled by an enemy wizard, on a 5+, that wizard surfers a wound with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: One use only. Declare you are using this item at the start of one of your magic phases. For the duration of the phase, when one of the bearer's spells is dispelled by an enemy wizard, roll a D6. On a 5+, that wizard surfers a wound with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Earthing Rod
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, can re-roll the Miscast
Artefact.Description: One use only. If the wizard rolls on the miscast table he can re-roll the result.

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a wizard who has a dispel scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell by using dispel dice. This automatically dispels the enemy spell; no dice roll is required. Note that even a dispel scroll will not help if the spell has been cast with Irresistible Force. Note also that a dispel scroll cannot be used to dispel spells that remain in play other than at the moment they are cast.

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Wizard can declare that he is using the power stone immediately before casting a spell. If he does so, two extra dice are added to the power dice that he is going to roll (you still need to roll at least one dice from the power pool).

Artefact.Name: Sceptre of Stability
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, can choose to increase one of his dispel results by an additional +D6, after his other dispel dice have been rolled
Artefact.Description: One use only. The bearer can choose to increase one of his dispel results by an additional +D6, after his other dispel dice have been rolled. This extra dispel dice can contribute to dispelling with Irresistible Force.

Artefact.Name: Channelling Staff
Artefact.Rule: +1 to all of his channeling attempts
Artefact.Description: The Wizard adds +1 to all of his channeling attempts.

Artefact.Name: Scroll of Shielding
Artefact.Rule: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, the target of the spell is granted a 4+ Ward save against any wounds caused by the spell
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Scroll of Shielding can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but the target of the spell is granted a 4+ Ward save against any wounds caused by the spell.

Artefact.Name: Wizarding Hat
Artefact.Description: The wearer is treated as being a Level 2 Wizard who can use a randomly chosen spell lore. However, he also has the Stupidity special rule.

Artefact.Name: Fozzrik's Folding Fortress
Artefact.Rule: After deployment zones have been agreed, but before the armies have been deployed, place a watchtower building in your deployment zone to represent rhe Folding Fortress
Artefact.Description: After deployment zones have been agreed, but before the armies have been deployed, place a watchtower building (or scratch-built structure of a similar size) in your deployment zone to represent rhe Folding Fortress. This is treated as a standard building. If you do not have a suitable building to place, you cannot use Fozzrik's Folding Fortress.

Artefact.Name: Arabyan Carpet
Artefact.Rule: Fly
Artefact.Description: Infantry or monstrous infantry models on foot only. The owner of this magical carpet has the Fly special rule. However, he cannot join units.

Artefact.Name: Crown of Command
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Crown of Command has the Stubborn special rule.

Artefact.Name: Healing Potion
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle recovers D6 Wounds lost in the battle
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Healing Potion can be drunk at the start of the controlling player's turn. The imbiber immediately recovers D6 Wounds lost in the battle.

Artefact.Name: Featherfoe Torc
Artefact.Rule: Flying creatures (and their riders) must re-roll successful rolls to hit against the bearer (and any unit he is with) in close combat
Artefact.Description: Flying creatures (and their riders) must re-roll successful rolls to hit against the bearer (and any unit he is with) in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Ruby Ring of Ruin
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, Power level 3: Fireball spell from Lore of Fire
Artefact.Description: Bound spell (power level 3). The Ruby Ring of Ruin contains the Fireball spell (see the Lore of Fire).

Artefact.Name: The Terrifying Mask of Eee!
Artefact.Description: The wearer of this mask causes Terror. However, other models can never use his Leadership.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Strength
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Strength until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Strength can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Strength until the end of the turn.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Toughness
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Toughness until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Toughness can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Toughness until the end of the turn.

Artefact.Name: The Other Trickster's Shard
Artefact.Description: Models in base contact with the bearer (friends and foes) must re-roll successful ward saves.

Artefact.Name: Ironcurse Icon
Artefact.Rule: The character (and any unit he is with) have 6+ Ward save against war machine weapons
Artefact.Description: The character (and any unit he is with) gain a 6+ ward save against war machine weapons.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Foolhardiness
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle character has the Immune to Psychology and the Devastating Charge special rules until the end of the player turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Foolhardiness can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has the Immune to Psychology and the Devastating Charge special rules until the end of the player turn.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Speed
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Speed can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn.

Individual.Rule: At the start of each enemy turn you can nominate D3 enemy units that are within 18" of Greasus to have the Stupidity special rule for the remainder of the turn
Unless Greasus is fleeing, all friendly units within 18" of Greasus, add +1 to their combat result scores, and automatically pass Rally tests
Can use the Lore of the Great Maw
Skrag and all Gorgers in the army receive the blessings of their ever-hungry god according to the special table by Cauldron of the Great Maw
At the start of a battle, before deployment, roll 2D6 and multiply the score by 10. You may equip Golgfag with magic items with a total points value that is equal to or less than the result.
Golgfag often goes to battle at the head of his veteran Maneaters unit: Golgfag's Maneaters always have the Stubborn and Vanguard special rules from the 'Been There, Done That' rule
Can use the Lore of the Great Maw, the Lore of Heavens, the Lore of Beasts, or the Lore of Death
Can use the Lore of Fire
4+ Ward save against any Attacks that have the Flaming Attacks special rule
Strength 4 Breath Weapon with the Flaming Attacks special rule
May choose two different special rules from: Immune to Psycology, Poisoned Attacks, Scouts, Sniper, Strider, Stubborn, Swiftsride, Vanguard
If a Hunter character joins a unit, then he has the Swiftsride special rule
Can not be joined by character other than Hunters
Any enemy in base contact suffer a -1 penalty to Weapon Skill
